title: lintian: misreports missing-build-dependency-for-dh_-command for use of dh_xine

sentences.text: lintian is misreporting missing-build-dependency-for-dh_-command for any package which build-depends on libxine2-dev and uses dh_xine.
|  _  | Darren Salt, using Debian GNU/Linux (and Android)
|  X  | ASCII Ribbon campaign against HTML e-mail
Modem, said the gardener when he'd finished the lawn..
libxine-dev 1.1.18.1-2 is older than the squeeze version, so we  shouldn't emit the error if build dependency is unversioned.
We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of lintian, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 659285@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Niels Thykier <niels@thykier.net> (supplier of updated lintian package)
(This message was generated automatically at their request;
if you believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)
+ [NT] Fixed assumptions about certain fields being present.
Where needed, Lintian will make guesses to the most likely        value (or the least "broken" value).
+ [JW] Check for ELF binaries installed in unsafe paths in        Multi-Arch: same packages.
to Jay Berkenbilt for the report.
This fixes a false-positive        "weak-library-dev-dependency" for some mono packages.
to David Bremner for the report.
+ [NT] Emit a tag if there is a syntax error in d/control rather        than just aborting the rest of the check.
+ [NT] Accepted patch from Gergely Nagy to catch dh-make vcs
Thanks to Paul Wise for suggesting this        check.
description to be clearer about the legal status of copyright        notices.
+ [NT] Added dh-autoreconf as a build-depends alternative to
+ [NT] Accepted patch from Paul Wise to detect COFF object
+ [NT] Properly handle unpacked being a symlink.
+ [NT] Accepted patch from Luca Falavigna to detect waf files
+ [RA] Recognize Perl uses of debconf templates via metaget or
+ [NT] Do not check executable debhelper files for brace        expansion if compat is 9 (or greater).
It may be allowed by        tool interpreting the file.
+ [NT] Added checks for handling executable files in the        debian dir.
Thanks to Joey Hess and Arno Tll for the
It is not shipped in        debhelper anymore (not even Squeeze) and the tag is not        emitted anymore (according to lintian.d.o).
+ [NT] Added check for missing compat file.
+ [JW] Properly handle uploader names with commas.
fixes some false-positives where python-zope packages were        wrongly identified as belong to the python section.
only be triggered if it was a "pre-depends" relation.
+ [JW] Include ssh:// as a valid protocol for hg.
+ [NT] Ignore self relations in Replaces and Provides.
+ [NT] Applied patch from intrigeri to remove "not-full-name"
+ [JW,NT] Skip "Multi-Arch: same" check of gzip files if their
+ [NT] Allow fonts in packages starting with "fonts-".
+ [NT] Re-added swfobject.js to the list of known javascript
Thanks to Paul Wise for noticing it had been        uploaded.
+ [NT] Check for file conflicts in binaries built from the same        source package.
+ [NT] Remove obsolete checks for wm-menu/wm-menu-config use in        maintainer scripts.
The executables are not shipped in menu        in Squeeze nor sid.
Furthermore the tags are not emitted in        any package (according to lintian.d.o).
+ [JW] Properly handle uploader names with commas.
+ [NT] Remove special handling for packages using yada.
+ [NT] Remove check for missing build-depends on yada.
+ [NT] Accepted patch from Evan Broder to check for missing        versioned pre-depends on dpkg when using maintscript helper.
This dependency is trivially satisfied in Debian, but may        complicate Ubuntu LTS upgrades.
+ [NT] Accepted patch from James McCoy to recognize "racket" as
+ [NT] Accepted patch from Martin Erik Werner to recognize
+ [JW] Check for Multi-Arch foreign packages shipping shared        libraries in public library directories.
+ [NT] Use the new hwcap-dirs data file to determine hwcap dirs.
+ [NT] Ignore missing symbols/shlibs files for libc libnss
+ [JW] Allow a trailing slash in the DEP-5 1.0 URL.
+ [NT] Use line numbers rather than "0-indexed" paragraph numbers        in the emitted tags.
Thanks to Jari Aalto for the suggestion.
+ [NT] Recommend the URI to the copyright-format subpolicy as
+ [NT] Ignore langpack symlinks if they appear to be consistent.
Thanks to Evan Broder for the report.
+ [NT] Properly handle unpacked being a symlink.
+ [NT] Do not open non-files when double-checking gzip files.
+ [NT] Pass "-N" to file as Lintian does not need the aligned        output.
+ [NT] Properly handle unpacked being a symlink.
+ [NT] Removed as they are no longer needed.
They have been        replaced by a smarter Lintian::Collect.
+ [NT] Pass --no-check to dpkg-source when requested not to
+ [JW] Add python3-sphinx as provider of sphinxdoc dh sequence.
+ [JW] Add python3-sphinx as provider of dh_sphinxdoc.
+ [NT] Added libxine-dev | libxine2-dev as provider of dh_xine.
Thanks to Michael Biebl for the
+ [JW] New data file for listing known hwcap dirs.
+ [NT] Auto-generate file with help from dpkg-architecture.
+ [NT] Added corrections for deprecate(d) and pedantic.
Triplett for the suggestion, investigative work and the        proposed patch to make this possible.
+ [JW] Add Build-Dependency on python-numpy and python-all-dev
+ [JW,NT] Remove the internal Lintian locale if a C.UTF-8 locale        is found in /usr/lib/locale.
+ [JW] Added trigger for libc-bin C.UTF-8 locale.
the internal Lintian locale can removed if libc-bin is upgraded        after Lintian.
+ [NT] Corrected the runtime estimate for an archive-wide run.
With 35 000+ packages, it can no longer be done in "a few        hours".
+ [NT] Removed deprecated variables and added sample TMPDIR        usage.
+ [NT] Allow -U to be given more than once.
+ [JW,NT] If using a temporary lab, print its location when        using --verbose option.
+ [NT] Fixed an issue where auto-clean would not see the real        status of some collections.
+ [NT] Keep auto-cleaned collections until all processables in
+ [NT] Attempt guess the version number when running in an git        checkout or unpacked source dir.
Based on patch from Evan        Broder.
+ [NT] Added support for the virtual "GROUP" type in Lab Queries.
This will make Lintian select all packages related to a given        source (and version).
This has been moved into        Lintian::Profile.
+ [NT] Allow TMPDIR in the configuration file.
release, pedantic tags were not affected by --display-level.
A side-effect of this is that "pedantic" can no longer be        used with "display-level" in the configuration file.
+ [NT] Produce a better error message when asked to process an        URL or a path that is definitely not a valid lab query.
Thanks to Nicholas Bamber for the report.
+ [NT] Support new override file format with -a.
+ [NT] Fixed the --profile argument, which now accepts the
mandatory parameter it is supposed to.
+ [NT] Do not check for missing uploader address as it cannot be        done reliably anymore.
+ [NT] Applied patch from intrigeri to remove the "not-full-name"
+ [NT] Only emit a spelling tag once for each spelling error in each        field/file/text.
+ [NT] Assume packages to be non-native when it cannot be        accurately determined due to missing version field.
+ [NT] Fixed an error in parsing symbol names when using readelf        as replacement for objdump.
an error that would cause lintian to skip some checks for udebs.
number of false-positive ownership tags if only numerical        ownership is available in the tarball.
Thanks to Thorsten        Glaser for the report.
+ [NT] Removed assumption that source packages always have a        format field.
+ [NT] Added "is_temp" method to identify temp labs from static        labs.
+ [NT] Corrected issue where the lab would record binaries as        being from "main", even if their "section" field implied        otherwise.
+ [NT] Properly strip whitespace when loading collection status.
+ [NT] Use part of the file name as package name if the mandatory        "Package" or "Source" fields are missing rather than choking.
+ [NT] Catch recursively defined profiles when the Profile field        contains a (slightly) different name than the Extends field of        its parent.
+ [NT] Handle loading of checks and tags.
+ [NT] Accepted patch from Evan Broder to always output effective        severity in tag descriptions.
+ [NT] Removed code to load tags from checks.
+ [NT] Emit "malformed-override" for architecture specific tags for        unknown architectures and for "arch:all" packages.
+ [NT] Use a Profile to determine if a tag is suppressed or not.
+ [NT] Count experimental tags as a separate group of tags.
This        fixes an issue where lintian would exit 1 if the only error        tags emitted were experimental.
+ [NT] Create clean_env function to handle cleaning of the        environment for children processes and finding a suitable UTF-8        locale (when needed).
+ [NT] Report line number instead of "0-indexed" paragraph number        in syntax errors.
Thanks to Jari Aalto for the suggestion.
+ [NT] Removed the notes that some options disable loading of a        profile.
Lintian now always loads a profile when doing checks.
+ [NT] Removed useless "TODO" message from the log output.
+ [NT] Added -h/--help option to print usage information.
+ [NT] A source package is now only processed if one (or more) of        its binaries are processed as well.
This avoids issues when some tools        prefers gpgv to gpg.
+ [JW] Properly handle uploader names with commas.
+ [NT] Use the severities from profiles when generating tag pages.
Based on patches from Evan Broder.
+ [NT] Removed tag loading code, which has moved into
+ [NT] Pass a profile to the templates (as $profile) instead of the        old %all hash.
+ [NT] List only source packages on the "packages_X.html" pages.
